name: NEW! ShelterBox 2013 Christmas Cards
description:
Our Christmas Cards for 2013 have just arrived! 

Each pack consists of 6 cards with 6 lovely designs ranging from traditional Father Christmas to more contemporary ice skating scenes.   All our cards contain the greeting 'With Best Wishes for Christmas and the New Year' with our ShelterBox logo on the back.

Size of each card 150mm x 150mm

All profits for these cards go to ShelterBox.

name: NEW! Christmas Wrapping Paper Pack
description:
A Christmas pack of wrapping paper containing 5 sheets of traditional Christmas wrap with matching gift tags.  The lovely designs include Santa, Christmas puddings, angels, reindeer and tree decorations.

Size of each wrapping sheet is 70mm x 50 mm

name: Sale Christmas Cards
description:
A pack of twelve (six of each of two designs) from charity Christmas cards loving designed by Nick Radford and Steph Ginger in 2011.  The cards were produced in aid of ShelterBox by creative communications and copywriting agency, Stranger Collective. 

+ A6 size
+ Envelopes included
+ Festive greeting printed inside
+ Printed on paper from sustainably managed forests

name: Sale christmas cards (2012)
description: Leading writing agency Stranger Collectivejoined forces with ShelterBox to create a special range of illustrated cards last Christmas 2012. Following up on the success of previous years, 2012 range includes designs by writer/illustrator collaborations including Helen Gilchrist with Telegramme, Luke Friend with 45rpm, Clare Howdle with Venn Creative, Jo Thomas with Rebecca Cobb, Lucy Cooper with Laura Callaghan, and Gemma Seltzer with Tom Hubmann. The 6 designs are based on the Shelter, Warmth and Dignity ShelterBox message. Each pack contains 12 cards (2 of each design). All profits for these cards go to ShelterBox.

name: Sale Christmas Gift Wrap
description:
Beautiful festive wrapping paper to compliment the 2012 Christmas Cards.

Using the bespoke designs from the cards created by Helen Gilchrist and Telegramme, Gemma Seltzer and Tom Hubmann.

4 thick quality Sheets -  2 of each design

Uncoated Size 420mm x 594mm per sheet

name: NEW YSB BOOK  'The Day the Bombs Fell'
description:
Our newest book 'The Day the Bombs Fell' is now available! 

Our new Young ShelterBox book is (as with the others in this series),  illustrated by UK primary school children and acclaimed children’s author/illustrator Michael Foreman and focuses on the topic of conflict.

£1 from each book sold will go directly to our Syria Refugee Appeal

name: Special Offer! YSB Book Bundle
description:
Young ShelterBox Books are illustrated by UK primary school children and acclaimed children's author and illustrator Michael Foreman. Full of colour and imagination, we see how a community pulls together and helps each other in the face of adversity.  

We have an offer for a LIMITED TIME ONLY for all three books describing tsunami, flood and earthquakes.

+ For primary school age (5-11yrs)
+ Printed on FSC certified paper
+ Book size: 20x20cms

name: ShelterBox Dog
description:
Our ShelterBox Dog has embroidered eyes and cloth nose and is made from bamboo derived viscose.  He is better for the enviroment, he is very soft and comes with his own Shelterbox bandana.  

Not suitable under 36 months as fur can shed

Measures at approx 20 cm in height.

name: Shelterbox Mug
description: Our newly designed mug in green and white.

name: ShelterBox Travel Coffee Mug
description:
Travel coffee mug with ShelterBox typeface logo. Perfect for keeping drinks hot in all conditions!

+ Stainless steel exterior
+ Plastic interior 
+ 450 ml capacity

name: ShelterBox Bear
description:
Our ShelterBox bear has embroidered eyes and cloth nose and is made from bamboo derived viscose.  He is better for the enviroment, he is very soft and comes with his own Shelterbox tee-shirt.  

Not suitable under 36 months as fur can shed

Measures at approx 28 cm in height.

name: Supporter Pin Badge
description:
Tarnish resistant metal badge with ShelterBox logo enamel front.

Clutch and pin fitting

Size 20mm x 15mm

FREE POSTAGE FOR THIS ITEM

name: ShelterBox Window Sticker
description:
Show your support and raise awareness of our work with our ShelterBox green window sticker.  

- approx 230mm x 80mm
- white backed removable vinyl

FREE POSTAGE FOR THIS ITEM

name: ShelterBox Badges (Sew-on)
description:
Our range of embroidered badges include:

Community Safety Badge:-

The aim of the Community Safety Badge is to help Scouts develop a greater understanding of what to do in an emergency situation and how they can help other members of their community.

ShelterBox Challenge Badge:-

The ShelterBox Challenge ran in 2010 as a 10 month program which over 25,000 scouts took part in, celebrating ShelterBox’s 10 year anniversary.  Badges are still available as a collectors’ item!

ShelterBox Promotional Badge:-

Your group may have taken part in the Go Global programme, a ShelterBox Scavenger Hunt or other Young ShelterBox activities for scouts.  You may like to recognise this with a badge for each of your group, supporting ShelterBox at the same time!

FREE POSTAGE FOR THESE ITEMS

name: ShelterBox charity supporter wristband
description:
Silicone wristband printed in ShelterBox green. 'ShelterBox Supporter' and 'www.shelterbox.org' are engraved on the band.

NO POSTAGE CHARGED FOR THIS ITEM

name: ShelterBox Cake Bake Kit
description:
Use our kit to create fabulous little cakes at anytime or you might want to consider using the kit to bake and sell cakes for a ShelterBox fundraiser.

Each kit contains 12 cupcake cases and 12 rice cake toppers with our ShelterBox logo. (cakes and stand not included)

Happy Baking!

FREE P&P for the cake bake kits.

name: ShelterBox emblem women’s Rugby shirt
description:
A quality long sleeved Rugby shirt with the new ShelterBox emblem on the chest. 

The emblem includes a Latin translation of our Disaster Relief strap line – Calamitas Solamen. 

Made in a semi fitted style with a traditional white woven collar. 

+ Quartered rugby shirt
+ Taped side vents
+ 97% ringspun cotton/ 3% elastane
+ 240gsm

Please consult sizing guide (right hand menu) for advice on garment fit.

To view detailed images of the product please click on the image arrow icons or the image numbers (below product image on left).

description:
A heavyweight Rugby shirt including the new ShelterBox emblem with a Latin translation of our Disaster Relief strap line – Calamitas Solamen. 

On the sleeve is the number 10, celebrating a decade of ShelterBox Disaster Relief and marking this item as a limited edition.

description:

name: A Gift of Hope......
description: This gift will help to support our on-going response to the Syria crisis. So far ShelterBox has sent aid to help over 4,500 families in Syria, Iraqi, Kurdistan, Lebanon and Jordan. Over the coming months we aim to provide shelter and other essential aid for a further 5,000 families fleeing the conflict in Syria. The little girl pictured was in the Domiz refugee camp in Iraqi Kurdistan. ShelterBox has distributed aid for 500 families in this camp, plus extra items such as stationery and activity packs to help refugee children continue their education and bring a sense of normality to their lives. When you purchase this gift we will send a card which you can write and give to your chosen recipient. A gift with a difference this year. HOW IT WORKS 1. Choose your Global Gift. 2. Add to the cart and pay at the checkout. 3. We'll send a gift card to you in the post. You can give this to someone you care about. 4. Your donation goes towards our vital work for the Syria Refugee Appeal. Gift Aid Please consider Gift Aiding your Global Gift. This will increase the value of your gift to ShelterBox Trust by 25%. Your Global Gift can be Gift Aided if the gift is a personal donation from the cardholder, and the cardholder will pay an amount in UK income tax/and or Capital Gains Tax at least equal to the amount of tax that all charities or Community Amateur Sports Clubs that the cardholder donates to will reclaim on their gifts in the appropriate tax year (currently 25p for every £1 given). Taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. Please select the gift aid option below.

name: ShelterBox Global Gift - 'Protection from disease'
description: Malaria kills an estimated 3,000 people every single day across the world. However, this deadly disease can be prevented by simply avoiding mosquito bites. We will send these mosquito nets to areas of the world where malaria and other mosquito spread diseases are prevalent. Each net is treated with a chemical which will keep mosquitoes away, providing families with a safe place to sleep. In northern Sri Lanka, civil war forced 150,000 people to flee their homes. In a ShelterBox camp for displaced families, our mosquito nets allowed these mothers pictured to keep their children safe from malaria. You will receive a greeting’s card which you can then write and give to your chosen recipient. A gift with a difference. HOW IT WORKS 1. Choose your Global Gift. 2. Add to the cart and pay at the checkout. 3. We'll send a gift card to you in the post. You can give this to someone you care about. 4. Your donation goes towards our vital disaster relief work. Gift Aid Please consider Gift Aiding your Global Gift. This will increase the value of your gift to ShelterBox Trust by 25%. Your Global Gift can be Gift Aided if the gift is a personal donation from the cardholder, and the cardholder will pay an amount in UK income tax/and or Capital Gains Tax at least equal to the amount of tax that all charities or Community Amateur Sports Clubs that the cardholder donates to will reclaim on their gifts in the appropriate tax year (currently 25p for every £1 given). Taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. Please select the gift aid option below

name: ShelterBox Global Gift - 'The tools for a new beginning'
description: For families who have lost everything, every piece of equipment they are provided with and every possession they salvage is invaluable. A basic toolkit containing items such as a hammer, trenching shovel and axe can provide families with the tools they need to rescue important items from their old homes or to rebuild what is vital for their survival. A donation of £22 can help us provide a family with the tools they need to rebuild their lives. Extensive flooding and landslides in the mountainouse regions of Peru forced hundreds of families to flee their homes. The tool kit enabled this man pictured to construct new irrigation systems for his fields and start rebuilding his life. You will recieve a gift card which you can then write and give to your chosen recipient. A gift with a difference. HOW IT WORKS 1. Choose your Global Gift. 2. Add to the cart and pay at the checkout. 3. We'll send a gift card to you in the post. You can give this to someone you care about. 4. Your donation goes towards the our vital disaster relief work. Gift Aid Please consider Gift Aiding your Global Gift. This will increase the value of your gift to ShelterBox Trust by 25%. Your Global Gift can be Gift Aided if the gift is a personal donation from the cardholder, and the cardholder will pay an amount in UK income tax/and or Capital Gains Tax at least equal to the amount of tax that all charities or Community Amateur Sports Clubs that the cardholder donates to will reclaim on their gifts in the appropriate tax year (currently 25p for every £1 given). Taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. Please select one of the gift aid options below

name: ShelterBox Global Gift - 'A box that matters'
description: Our boxes are more than simple containers for transporting equipment; they have been tables, they have been cots, they have been baths but above all, these big green boxes are symbols of hope. This tardis provides a secure place for all our equipment to be transported, so we can be sure that items won’t go missing or become damaged. After losing their hillside homes in a landslide, women from the Mayan community of Santa Catarina Palopo in Guatemala (pictured) collect their ShelterBoxes knowing they'll bring shelter,warmth and dignity to their families. You will receive a gift card which you can write and give to your chosen recipient. A gift with a difference. HOW IT WORKS 1. Choose your Global Gift. 2. Add to the cart and pay at the checkout. 3. We'll send a gift card to you in the post. You can give this to someone you care about. 4. Your donation goes towards the our vital disaster relief work. Gift Aid Please consider Gift Aiding your Global Gift. This will increase the value of your gift to ShelterBox Trust by 25%. Your Global Gift can be Gift Aided if the gift is a personal donation from the cardholder, and the cardholder will pay an amount in UK income tax/and or Capital Gains Tax at least equal to the amount of tax that all charities or Community Amateur Sports Clubs that the cardholder donates to will reclaim on their gifts in the appropriate tax year (currently 25p for every £1 given). Taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. Please select the Gift Aid option below

name: ShelterBox Global Gift - 'Clean water following disaster'
description: When homes have been destroyed, it is likely that the infrastructure of a country will be too and families will be left without access to safe drinking water. It is recommended that each individual should drink approximately three litres of water a day but in certain locations this can result in disease and potentially death. Our water purification equipment will allow families to filter dirty water so they can be sure that it is safe to drink. This mother of three pictured from Western Kenya collects her water from a stream that is also used by animals and people washing. When possible she would boil the water to clean it. With her new water filtration equipment she can be sure her children always have clean water to drink. You will recieve a gift card which you can then write and give to your chosen recipient. A gift with a difference. HOW IT WORKS 1. Choose your Global Gift. 2. Add to the cart and pay at the checkout. 3. We'll send a gift card to you in the post. You can give this to someone you care about. 4. Your donation goes towards our vital disaster relief work. Gift Aid Please consider Gift Aiding your Global Gift. This will increase the value of your gift to ShelterBox Trust by 25%. Your Global Gift can be Gift Aided if the gift is a personal donation from the cardholder, and the cardholder will pay an amount in UK income tax/and or Capital Gains Tax at least equal to the amount of tax that all charities or Community Amateur Sports Clubs that the cardholder donates to will reclaim on their gifts in the appropriate tax year (currently 25p for every £1 given). Taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. Please select the Gift Aid option below

name: ShelterBox Global Gift - 'Warmth and protection'
description: Nights can get cold and in certain parts of the world, such as the mountainous regions of Afghanistan and Pakistan, staying warm means survival. Thermal blankets will provide a family with the warmth they need to endure the harsh conditions they may be living in, while our insulated groundsheets will be invaluable in parts of the world where temperatures plummet at nightfall. Your donation could help us send blankets and ground mats to help people remain warm once they have lost their homes. Heavy rainfall caused flooding across Northern Namibia, leaving towns under water and families stranded. Our blankets provided families with the warmth and protection they needed, like this mother and her new-born baby (pictured). You will receive a gift card which you can write and give to your chosen recipient. A gift with a difference. HOW IT WORKS 1. Choose your Global Gift. 2. Add to the cart and pay at the checkout. 3. We'll send a gift card to you in the post. You can give this to someone you care about. 4. Your donation goes towards our vital disaster relief work. Gift Aid Please consider Gift Aiding your Global Gift. This will increase the value of your gift to ShelterBox Trust by 25%. Your Global Gift can be Gift Aided if the gift is a personal donation from the cardholder, and the cardholder will pay an amount in UK income tax/and or Capital Gains Tax at least equal to the amount of tax that all charities or Community Amateur Sports Clubs that the cardholder donates to will reclaim on their gifts in the appropriate tax year (currently 25p for every £1 given). Taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. Please select the Gift Aid option below

name: ShelterBox Global Gift - 'Aid reaching those most in need'
description: Fast and safe delivery of a ShelterBox is vital in ensuring that families made homeless by disaster are provided with the means for survival as soon as possible. We will use any means to ensure that our aid reaches those most in need, whether it’s by plane, boat, donkey or a combination of all three! Our aid is delivered by highly trained ShelterBox Response Team volunteers, whose job it is to ensure that ShelterBoxes are delivered and distributed to the families who need them most in an effective and responsible way. When a 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck Haiti, it caused destruction on an unimaginable scale. ShelterBox Response Team members like David Eby and Wayne Robinson pictured, worked closely with international aid agencies and local organisations to ensure aid reached the most vulnerable families and communities in a matter of days. You will receive a gift card which you can then write and give to your chosen recipient. A gift with a difference HOW IT WORKS 1. Choose your Global Gift. 2. Add to the cart and pay at the checkout. 3. We'll send a gift card to you in the post. You can give this to someone you care about. 4. Your donation goes towards our vital disaster relief work. Gift Aid Please consider Gift Aiding your Global Gift. This will increase the value of your gift to ShelterBox Trust by 25%. Your Global Gift can be Gift Aided if the gift is a personal donation from the cardholder, and the cardholder will pay an amount in UK income tax/and or Capital Gains Tax at least equal to the amount of tax that all charities or Community Amateur Sports Clubs that the cardholder donates to will reclaim on their gifts in the appropriate tax year (currently 25p for every £1 given). Taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. Please select the Gift Aid option below

name: ShelterBox Global Gift - 'A heart to the home'
description: Our stove and stainless steel cooking equipment provides families with a heart to their new home, where water can be boiled, food can be cooked and families can congregate. Like all our equipment, the stove and stainless steel kitchen set are of long lasting quality and will be of use to communities affected by disaster for years. Extensive flooding across Colombia left 200,00 homes destroyed. After moving into their new ShelterBox tent, the family pictured were able to spend time together preparing their evening meal on the stove. You will a gift card which you can then write and give to your chosen recipient. A gift with a difference. HOW IT WORKS 1. Choose your Global Gift. 2. Add to the cart and pay at the checkout. 3. We'll send a gift card to you in the post. You can give this to someone you care about. 4. Your donation goes towards our vital disaster relief work. Gift Aid Please consider Gift Aiding your Global Gift. This will increase the value of your gift to ShelterBox Trust by 25%. Taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. Please select the Gift Aid option below

name: ShelterBox Global Gift - 'Shelter'
description: Hundreds of thousands of people all over the world have found shelter, warmth and dignity inside one of our tents when they had absolutely nothing before. Having a space to call your home is invaluable. Our disaster relief tent is custom made by Vango and is designed to withstand extreme temperatures, high winds and heavy rainfall. When a category four cyclone hit the eastern shores of Madagascar, fierce winds and torrential rains ripped through towns and devastated 500 communities. This family pictured were living under a tree with what was left of their roof leaning against it to give them some protection. In their ShelterBox tent, the family are safe and can start rebuilding their lives. You will recieve a gift card which you can then write and give to your chose recipient. A gift with a difference. HOW IT WORKS 1. Choose your Global Gift. 2. Add to the cart and pay at the checkout. 3. We'll send a gift card to you in the post. You can give this to someone you care about. 4. Your donation goes towards our vital disaster relief work. Gift Aid Please consider Gift Aiding your Global Gift. This will increase the value of your gift to ShelterBox Trust by 25%. Your Global Gift can be Gift Aided if the gift is a personal donation from the cardholder, and the cardholder will pay an amount in UK income tax/and or Capital Gains Tax at least equal to the amount of tax that all charities or Community Amateur Sports Clubs that the cardholder donates to will reclaim on their gifts in the appropriate tax year (currently 25p for every £1 given). Taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. Please select the Gift Aid option below

name: ShelterBox Global Gift - 'A new start'
description: ShelterBoxes containing our specially designed disaster relief tent and items such as a stove, kitchen set, toolkit, water purification equipment and mosquito nets, will mean the world to a family somewhere in the world who have had their homes destroyed by disaster. A complete box will provide a family with the equipment they need to survive and start rebuilding their lives once they have lost everything. Flooding in North East Brazil left 100,000 people homeless. Mrs Alves (pictured), her two-month-old daughter Emily Maria and five-year-old son Isaias were sheltering in an overcrowded school. When Mrs Alves received her tent and ShelterBox she wept with tears of joy: "I'm so happy that my family will be safe". You will a gift card which you can then write and give to your chosen recipient. A gift with a difference. HOW IT WORKS 1. Choose your Global Gift. 2. Add to the cart and pay at the checkout. 3. We'll send a gift card to you in the post. You can give this to someone you care about. 4. Your donation goes towards our vital disaster relief work. Gift Aid Please consider Gift Aiding your Global Gift. This will increase the value of your gift to ShelterBox Trust by 25%.
